percentage_complete.description: Percentage of obligatory metadata fields populated.

short_name.title: Short name
short_name.description: Name of (physical) data file, data table or dataset
short_name.$comment: Alphanumeric limited to a-z, A-Z, 0-9, - (hyphen) and _ (underscore)

assessment.title: Assessment
assessment.description: Value assessment (sensitivity classification) for the data set

description.title: Description
description.description: Free text description of the data set

data_source.title: Data source
data_source.description: Data source. Set either for the data set or instance variable.

population_description.title: Description of population
population_description.description: Description of the population covered in the data set. Includes unit type, spatial coverage and period of time.

version_description.title: Version description
version_description.description: Dataset version information in the form of descriptive text

unit_type.title: Unit type
unit_type.description: Unit Type for data file, table or data set. See Definitions of Unit Types https://www.ssb.no/en/metadata/definisjoner-av-statistiske-enheter

temporality_type.title: Temporality type
temporality_type.description: Temporality type. Either for the instance variable or the data set

subject_field.title: Subject field
subject_field.description: Primary area of statistics in which the data set is included

keyword.title: Keyword(s)
keyword.description: A list of searchable keywords that can contribute to the development of effective filtering and search services.

spatial_coverage_description.title: Spatial coverage description
spatial_coverage_description.description: Description of the data set's spatial coverage

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique identifier for the data set

owner.title: Owner
owner.description: Owner of the data set (responsible division in Statistics Norway). See also Classification of organisational units https://www.ssb.no/en/klass/klassifikasjoner/83

file_path.title: File path
file_path.description: The file path contains the data set's name and the path to where it is stored

metadata_created_date.title: Metadata created date
metadata_created_date.description: Created date for metadata about the data set

metadata_last_updated_date.title: Metadata last updated date
metadata_last_updated_date.description: Last updated date for metadata about the dataset

metadata_last_updated_by.title: Metadata last updated by
metadata_last_updated_by.description: Last change made by identifiable person.

contains_data_from.title: Contains data from
contains_data_from.description: The data set contains data from date/time

contains_data_until.title: Contains data up until
contains_data_until.description: The data set contains data up until date/time

short_name.title: Short name
short_name.description: Physical name of the variable in the dataset. Should match the recommended short name.

name.title: Name
name.description: Variable names can be inherited from VarDef, but can also be documented/changed here

variable_role.title: Variable role
variable_role.description: Role of the instance variable in the data set

definition_uri.title: Definition URI
definition_uri.description: A link (URI) to the variable's definition in Vardok/VarDef

direct_person_identifying.title: Direct Person identifying Information (DPI)
direct_person_identifying.description: Direct Person identifying Information (DPI). Some of the values ​​in an instance variable kan be DPI, others not. In this case, DPI is set equal to true. For example, the variable exporter where some of the values ​​can be organization number, others social security numbers (sole proprietorships).

data_source.title: Data source
data_source.description: Data source. Set at data set level, but can be overwritten at variable instance level.

population_description.title: Population description
population_description.description: The population the variable describes can be specified in more detail here. Set at dataset level, but can be overwritten at instance variable level.

comment.title: Comment
comment.description: Further clarification of the variables definition

temporality_type.title: Temporality type
temporality_type.description: Temporality type. Set either for variable instance or dataset.

measurement_unit.title: Measurement unit
measurement_unit.$comment: TODO: measurement_unit implemented as string. In the future this should be implemente as enum? See https://www.ssb.no/klass/klassifikasjoner/303/koder

format.title: Format
format.description: The format of the values ​​(physical format or regular expression) in machine-readable form for validation. This can be used as a further specification of the data type (dataType) in those cases where this is relevant.

classification_uri.title: Classification or codelist URI
classification_uri.description: Link (URI) to valid classification or code list

sentinel_value_uri.title: Sentinel value URI
sentinel_value_uri.description: A link (URI) to an overview of sentinel values included in the variable. Proposals for the standardization of sentinel values ​​have been drafted, but this has not yet been processed by the Standards Committee in Statistics Norway:  01 - In total, 02 - Sum, 03 - Subtotal, 04 - Other, 05 - Rest, 06 - Invalid value, 07 - Unspecified, 08 - Not relevant

invalid_value_description.title: Invalid value(s) description
invalid_value_description.description: Invalid value(s) description used in addition (or as an alternative) to standard sentinel values.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: Unique SSB identifier for the instance variable in the data set

contains_data_from.title: Contains data from
contains_data_from.description: The instance variable in the data set contains data from and including this date. This can be useful information for data sets that contain many instance variables in addition to data for many periods/years. In many cases, it will then be the case that some variables only contain data for the most recent periods/years, e.g. if the entire data set contains data from 1970 to 2020, while some instance variables only contain data from 1998 onwards.

contains_data_until.title: Contains data up until
contains_data_until.description: The instance variable in the data set contains data up to and including this date. This can be useful information for data sets that contain many instance variables in addition to data for many periods/years. In many cases, it will then be the case that some of the instance variables in the data set are terminated (no longer updated) after a given point in time.
